Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Statuette of a sparrow hawk (kite)
Description: The facial markings are those of a falcon. Back, wings and tail are covered by a blue net (perhaps imitating the bead net that adorned the mummy) on a red background.Carved birds like this one were part of the tomb equipment in the Late Period. They were placed on mummiform coffins, canopic chests, funerary stelae and on the bases of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris statues, and protected the deceased with their magic. The missing piece on the chest Ã„OS 6611 was replaced by this kite.
